title: Looking for Inspiration: Carnival Ads
content: Hey everyone, I'm working on a summer convention project as a volunteer. I'm looking for old Carnival/Sideshow Advertisements. Anyone have good places to look? I'm looking locally and browsing the internet. Help me out if you can.
author: circehouse

comments.content: And a gem I dug up from the LOC a few years ago: [Performing Monkeys](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417122650/http:/stewf.com/jamie/pmj/)

One site I think you'll find quite inspiring can be found at: [http://www.circusmuseum.nl](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417122650/http:/www.circusmuseum.nl/ "http://www.circusmuseum.nl")

You can also Google "Snap Wyatt" and get a great overview of his work and that of other sideshow banner artists.

This book has a ton of them

[http://www.amazon.com/Freaks-Geeks-Strange-Girls-Varndell/dp/086719622X/...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417122650/http:/www.amazon.com/Freaks-Geeks-Strange-Girls-Varndell/dp/086719622X/ref=sr_1_1/102-3713412-0612115?ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1178025229&sr=1-1 "http://www.amazon.com/Freaks-Geeks-Strange-Girls-Varndell/dp/086719622X/ref=sr\_1\_1/102-3713412-0612115?ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1178025229&sr=1-1")

I have an old freakshow poster myself.
Flickr has a crazy amount of pools full of carnival posters.

This site for posters of magician
